alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 03 at 2:03PM MST until January 06 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow likely. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible with locally higher amounts. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph. Snow amounts closer to 8 to 12 inches in Centennial and Albany. * WHERE...Sierra Madre and Snowy Ranges to include Centennial and Albany. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel could be extremely difficult or impossible due to icy, snow packed roads and near zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation could become life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers may easily become disoriented. Frostbite and hypothermia can develop quickly.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
